The first construction will be one of the two Noggles Sculptures (~17m x ~6m) on the road in front of the river. The entire project scope includes:

Public Makerspace (Workshops, Printing equipment, Private studios)
Design Library
Computer center
Coworking space
Community kitchen
Daily food deliveries to homeless

Free Nouns Coffee
The first annual Nouns exhibition “Sculptures across the City”

Spread the word of Nouns DAO through education - the space will have the tools to help people create all mediums of art, garden will be a forever growing gallery of Nounish sculptures, 3D printers, Library, Computer Center, Cafe with kids tablecloths that have outlined Nouns to be coloured in etc.

Expand Nounishness into Argentina (one of the epicentres of crypto-adoption) and establish a physical location where Nounish folk can meet and the general public can get wise to Nouns and crypto. Create the largest (at least we think) Noggles on earth.

All these important events will be filmed and photographed, to later be edited and published on various social media channels to generate content for the DAO of the actions carried out.

## 🧑‍🌾 **Background/Problem Statement**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1o4vxAla.jpg)
*📝 Map of low-income and low-access areas in the U.S. 
Source: Economic Research Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture*

Food access is a multi-faceted issue. Because food has not been treated as a public good, **over 1.1 billion people globally, including ~10% of the U.S., are food insecure;** meaning they have limited access to stores that offer a variety of healthy and affordable food. This creates severe challenges:
### Public Health
- **Stunted Childhoods and Learning Disorders**: "Longitudinal studies in Canada indicate that hunger is related to poor health outcomes, including a higher risk of depression and suicidal ideation in adolescents, and chronic conditions, particularly asthma. In addition, nutrient deficiencies, such as iron deficiency, are known to impair learning and cause decreased productivity in school-age children, and maternal depressive disorders." - [Food insecurity and hunger: A review of the effects on children’s health and behaviour](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4373582/)
- **Cardiovascular Disease**: A study published in [the Journal of the American Heart Association](https://www.ahajournals.org/doi/full/10.1161/JAHA.119.014629) included more than 27,000 adults surveyed from 1999 to 2014. Researchers found more cardiovascular disease and higher overall death rates among those reporting food insecurity.
- **Obesity**: "Highly energy-dense processed foods that are high in saturated fats, sugars, and sodium are consumed more often than micronutrient-dense quality foods. Energy-dense foods may help meet daily caloric requirements, but essential nutrients are missing. Therefore, in many countries, undernutrition and obesity coexist and both can be consequences of food insecurity." - [Food insecurity as a risk factor for obesity: A review](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9549066/)
### Economic Opportunity
Individuals who live in low-income, low-access neighborhoods tend to deal with employment challenges. This is often due to a lack of economic opportunity in their neigborhood, a lack of positive role models, and interactions with the criminal justice system.
### Global Supply Chains
In the United States, processed foods travel an average of 1,300 miles (~2,100 KM), and fresh produce travels an average of 1,500  miles (~2,400 KM) to get to your local grocery store. - [Food Miles: Background and Marketing](https://attra.ncat.org/publication/food-miles-background-and-marketing/#:~:text=The%20Leopold%20Center%20found%20that,traveled%20amounted%20to%201%2C518%20miles.)

The United Nation's [2021 State of Food and Agriculture report](https://www.fao.org/3/cb4476en/online/cb4476en.html) states that in over 45 nations, the closure of a single route could increase food travel times by 20%+

## 💡 **Proposed Solution**
🌐 [*https://thecityfarmers.org/*](https://thecityfarmers.org/)

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Skh4ws0x6.png)


📝 *This is what we're building towards, the 10-year vision.
Vertical farming in solar glass greenhouses.* 

**** is the premier program of the Kenwood Training Center, a 501c3 non-profit headquartered in Chicago.

We are dedicated to empowering individuals, particularly those with criminal records and veterans, through comprehensive training in sustainable urban agriculture.  Our goal is to promote self-sufficiency and personal growth by equipping them with the skills to operate and own their own greenhouses.

Parallel to this, we champion vibrant neighborhoods. By transforming vacant city lots into commercial agricultural greenhouses, we contribute to the vitality and sustainability of urban communities.

Our finances are managed by the Public Health Institute of Metropolitan Chicago, another 501c3 non-profit, in return for 10% of all donations received.

## 🌟 **Opportunity**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rk9EuERea.jpg)

📝 *We have the opportunity today to get ahead of an exponential global trend.*
*Source: [Data Bridge Market Research](https://www.databridgemarketresearch.com/reports/global-urban-farming-market)*

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkDeetCe6.png)

📝 *"In 2022, food spending by U.S. consumers, businesses, and government entities totaled $2.39 trillion" - [Economic Research Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture](https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/ag-and-food-statistics-charting-the-essentials/food-prices-and-spending/#:~:text=U.S.%20food%20spending%20in%202020%20totaled%20%241.81%20trillion.,trillion%20in%202021%20to%20%241.34%20trillion%20in%202022.)*

Nouns is an engine for the development of public goods. Access to fresh, nutritionally rich foods is a key determinent of long term mental health and physical wellness. By reframing food as a public good, we have the potential to uplift the whole of society and proliferate the meme through the direct route to people's hearts: their stomachs.

### **Research & Develop Urban Agriculture** 
Kobe University's Graduate School of Agricultural Science in Japan has researched dry-fog aeroponics since 2011. When growing lettuce, this method uses 90-95% less water and 98% less land than traditional agriculture. We can build upon this research to include new crops and refine the method, in partnership with the [Illinois Institute of Technology's Institute of Food Safety & Health](https://www.ifsh.iit.edu/) and the United States Department of Agriculture, who are opening their first ever Urban Ag office in Chicago towards the end of this year and have $9 million of grants we qualify for.
### **Bring Ag Carbon Onchain** 
We're in conversation with developers focused on omnichain & web2 interopability to bring [agricultrual carbon data](https://cid-inc.com/plant-science-tools/leaf-area-measurement/ci-340-handheld-photosynthesis-system/) onchain. There are millions of dollars of government and private grants available for this R&D work.
### **Food as Medicine**
Public health agencies and providers are increasingly recognizing the role of food and nutrition in health outcomes. The Public Health Institute of Metropolitan Chicago has partnered with us and manages our finances. Their deep connections in the pubic health field place us in a strong position to secure grants for this work. 
### **Workforce Development** 
PHIMC also has deep connections with the Illinois Department of Justice and a commitment to restorative justice programs. It is our goal to leverage this to create a workorce development program for individuals with criminal records. We have a pilot location in mind next door to a Juvenile Detention Facility in Chicago.
### **Grassroots Community Empowerment**
By refining the methods and educating the people, Nouns stands to empower low-income, low-access neighborhoods to develop into thriving, sustainable communities by directly addressing their core issues: *health, local nutritious food, and equitable employment.*
### **Ultimate Proliferation**
Bringing Nouns into the grocery store, refigerator, and people's stomachs makes it a household brand, while living true to the founding principles of positive impact through public goods.


Our mission to make nutrious food a public good may be ambitious, however the impact that success would have across society makes it an obvious bet.

# Let's make a short animated film to fund the Protocol Guild

[![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJuogvxb6.jpg)](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/npgcssj0xy1xyid9utxob/Nouns_Pitch.mov?rlkey=z8cgbr02oza3e6wl1h3scv54z&dl=0)

## TL;DR

Let’s make a ~45s short animated film to celebrate [Protocol Guild's](https://protocol-guild.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#) work on Ethereum, release it as a droposal, and donate the proceeds of the mint to fund Ethereum core development. This prop requests $400k USDC to hire [The Line](https://www.thelineanimation.com/), a BAFTA-nominated animation studio to make this short film. 
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Sy9sXPeZa.png)

## Edit note from candidate feedback

This prop has been updated from its candidate stage to fix a funding request typo. It's 400k, not 500k USC. Also want to acknowledge the excellent feedback from Noun 40 and Trent re: shifting the framing of Protocol Guild from glamorous heroes to tireless stewards / maintainers in the co-created universe of Ethereum. We will work that feedback in with The Line and post an updated script via Propdate.

## Why support Protocol Guild? 
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1yDWDxWa.jpg)

Nouns love public art and software, and Protocol Guild maintains the most important public software to us: Ethereum. We've demonstrated this in the past to the [tune of 500 ETH](https://www.nounsagora.com/proposals/108). Instead of continuing with direct donation, I'm proposing that we leverage our financial and creative resources to make a film about PG, and release it as a mintable NFT whose proceeds go towards the Guild.

This is not only great for PG, but also affords us a unique opportunity to use nounish imagery, characters and themes in a piece of media that will widely seen in our prime demographic of humans who love and care for ethereum.

It's true that "donating" via a mintable film is more risky than giving money directly – but I think telling the story of Ethereum and Protocol Guild through the lens of Nouns is something we can uniquely do. Other DAOs like UNI and LIDO may be able to donate more due to their larger treasury – but none have the mission and mandate to fund creative endeavours like we do.

A successful $400k investment in storytelling can have a **broader reach** than our previous 500ETH investment and drive far **more direct positive attention** to Nouns while at the same time providing financial and cultural support to Protocol Guild. And we have evidence this can work, both from our [past](https://www.thisisnouns.wtf/) [successful](https://www.premiere.wtf/) droposals and the [Stand with crypto](https://zora.co/collect/eth:0x9d90669665607f08005cae4a7098143f554c59ef) mint.

## What's the story we're going to tell?

[![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJuogvxb6.jpg)](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/npgcssj0xy1xyid9utxob/Nouns_Pitch.mov?rlkey=z8cgbr02oza3e6wl1h3scv54z&dl=0)

Please watch Bjorn, our director, tell you the story, settings, and characters in his voice. We're working with a draft story and visual references, and will be refining it all over time with input from the Nouns community. Our current draft story is something like this:

>This is a story set in a floating port town, which metaphorically represents the Ethereum ecosystem. Everyone is gathered to celebrate the return of the Protocol Guild, a group of adventurers bringing back innovations that will improve the town (metaphorically EIP-4844). The Nouns play host to these adventurers by inviting them to a big feast. We follow a young child who looks up to the Protocol Guild and follows them across their journey around town, in hope of meeting his heroes.

If you'd like to check out [the draft script](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1T1Gw8W74_9BR_o6ADetRxnyxza-SPR7lZdof9jTPslg/edit?usp=sharing) yourself!

## Who's making the film?

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/r1OnCNL1a.jpg)

We're working with The Line – a BAFTA-nominated animation studio whose work span across work for major brands and original animation. They've worked extensively with top tier artists and brands like [Gorillaz](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/gorillaz), [Lil Nas X](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/lilnasx-star-walkin), and [Marvel Studios](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/hero-marvel-snap), and [Nickelodeon](https://www.thelineanimation.com/work/nickelodeon-vines). Our director will be Bjorn-Erik Aschim, who's also a studio co-founder.

I reached out to them not only because they worked on a [viral Chobani video about a solarpunk farm](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z-Ng5ZvrDm4) – which I think visually and emotively embodies the vision the aspiration of Nouns and Ethereum really well, but also because they are one of the best studios in the world, whose work is widely recognized in the creative industry.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/H11spyae6.png)

## Funding & milestones
**Funding**

I'm requesting $400k USDC to fund this short animation. 100% of the amount goes to The Line to fund the development of the film. The funds will be released over 2 milestones: 1/2 upfront, and 1/2 upon completion.

Milestone payment will be held in an escrow multisig whose signers are the Agora team and will be disbursed to The Line upon milestone completion. In the unlikely event that the film cannot be completed, the remainder funds will be returned to the DAO.

Then, trent.eth from Protocol Guild will submit another proposal to the DAO to release the short film as a droposal with 70% of the proceeds going to Protocol Guild, 20% to Nouns treasury, and 10% to Agora. 


## What's Agora / Yitong's role in this?
I'm incredibly excited about more Nouns-produced short films released as Droposals, because there's a real flywheel here if we can demonstrate that Nouns can create super high quality short films that also have real mint value. 

It's why we're working on an [easy Droposals](https://www.nounsagora.com/proposals/346) creator at Agora, and I can think of no better film than one about Ethereum itself to demonstrate the power of Droposals.


## Timeline
Dates are approximate, and may change by a few days depending on exact timing of the candidate approval. During the process, Yitong will serve as liaison between The Line and the Nouns community to make sure we have the chance to provide feedback during each phase of production.

w/c 19th Oct - Proposal approved (PAYMENT MILESTONE 1 50%)
w/c 26th Oct - Creative Phase commences
w/c 10th Nov - Creative Phase Deck Approval
w/c 16 Nov - Pre-production commences

w/c 21th Dec - Layout approve
w/c 21th Dec - Production commences
w/c 25 Dec - Christmas Break
w/c 25th Jan - Animation approve
w/c 25th Feb - Comp approved
w/c 22 Feb - Final Delivery (PAYMENT MILESTONE 2 50%)


## A story in chapters

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/ryKSTlTeT.png)
If we're successful with this first film, we can serialize this into a series of short animations celebrating major Ethereum milestones so that we can both create an ongoing source of funding for Protocol Guild, and tell an episodic story that builds into a larger narrative and universe that can stand on its own and be appealing to a mass audience who might not even know about Nouns or Ethereum.

# Let's make a short animated film to fund the Protocol Guild

[![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJuogvxb6.jpg)](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/npgcssj0xy1xyid9utxob/Nouns_Pitch.mov?rlkey=z8cgbr02oza3e6wl1h3scv54z&dl=0)

## TL;DR

Let’s make a ~45s short animated film to celebrate [Protocol Guild's](https://protocol-guild.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#) work on Ethereum, release it as a droposal, and donate the proceeds of the mint to fund Ethereum core development. ![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Sy9sXPeZa.png)

This prop has been updated from its candidate stage to fix a funding request typo. We will work that feedback in with The Line and post an updated script via Propdate.

## Why support Protocol Guild? 
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1yDWDxWa.jpg)

Nouns love public art and software, and Protocol Guild maintains the most important public software to us: Ethereum. We've demonstrated this in the past to the [tune of 500 ETH](https://www.nounsagora.com/proposals/108). Instead of continuing with direct donation, I'm proposing that we leverage our financial and creative resources to make a film about PG, and release it as a mintable NFT whose proceeds go towards the Guild.

This is not only great for PG, but also affords us a unique opportunity to use nounish imagery, characters and themes in a piece of media that will widely seen in our prime demographic of humans who love and care for ethereum.

It's true that "donating" via a mintable film is more risky than giving money directly – but I think telling the story of Ethereum and Protocol Guild through the lens of Nouns is something we can uniquely do. Other DAOs like UNI and LIDO may be able to donate more due to their larger treasury – but none have the mission and mandate to fund creative endeavours like we do.

A successful $400k investment in storytelling can have a **broader reach** than our previous 500ETH investment and drive far **more direct positive attention** to Nouns while at the same time providing financial and cultural support to Protocol Guild. Everyone is gathered to celebrate the return of the Protocol Guild, a group of adventurers bringing back innovations that will improve the town (metaphorically EIP-4844). The Nouns play host to these adventurers by inviting them to a big feast. We follow a young child who looks up to the Protocol Guild and follows them across their journey around town, in hope of meeting his heroes.

# Propdates 2.0

*“What ever happened to Prop #123?”
“What was the most successful Nouns proposal?”
“Which proposals should we try to repeat?”
“Who are our most committed contributors?”*

[Propdates](https://updates.wtf) is here to answer these questions. With contracts built by Wilson, Propdates is the best way to keep up with Nouns proposals after they pass, and an entirely new design space within the greater Nouns ecosystem. We’ve never had any consistent, onchain way to keep track of contributors’ work, and no way to recommend regular updates. Down the line, one could imagine Propdates as an onchain oracle for proposal progress.

## PROGRESS SO FAR
I built the Propdates site and public graph, inspired by Krel’s [requests.wtf](http://requests.wtf). What started as a weekend experiment has grown into something much bigger: it’s clear that we’ve tapped into something special. In fact, Propdates has already become part of the pre-proposal conversation process - it is expected that a proposer regularly updates the DAO on their work. In just a few weeks, we already have had 17 unique posters, and more coming.

![](https://i.ibb.co/mt9nCgz/metrics.png)
![](https://i.ibb.co/CzXyQrg/other.png)

## LOOKING AHEAD
We’d like to move Propdates from an experiment to a fully-featured Nouns app and a key part of the ecosystem, on par with teams like Agora, Federation, Prop House. Our end goal is for Propdates to be a protocol any contract or app can plug into to determine a proposal’s success. It is clear that it could expand further than just Nouns.

We are asking for three months of funding (more on the team below). Martin will be close to full-time, but working on other projects as well (similar to almost all software proposers). We expect Onion to be part time for two months or so. For these months, our priorities will be:
1.  Contract improvements to expand functionality  & data
	- New channels to post updates in: prop house entries, user channels, custom channels
	- Revamped admin system / permissions + “Super Admin” to unlock proposals where proposer is unresponsive
	- Explore contract to update/revoke streams based on a proposal's updates
2.  Improved editor, claiming and submitting UX
	- Easy image upload via Arweave or IPFS (and potentially expand as a public good for Nouns ecosystem)
	- In-app markdown editor and previews for better UX
3.  Farcaster integration for likes & comments on updates
4.  Open Editions to celebrate Completed Props

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/SylB1lAep.png)

## Developing the workforce by decentralizing agriculture in blighted food deserts.

[https://thecityfarmers.org/](https://thecityfarmers.org/)

---
## 📌 **TLDR**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1zlywmW6.png)


### **Requesting 300,000 USDC**

- Rent a warehouse.
- Purchase growing equipment and materials.
- Hire a grantwriter and a videographer/editor.
- Become self-sustaining without requiring further funding.

*Funding the research & development of urban agriculture as a public good, while proliferating Nouns ⌐◨-◨*

---

## 🧑‍🌾 **Background & Problem Statement**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1o4vxAla.jpg)
*📝 Map of low-income and low-access areas in the U.S. 
Source: Economic Research Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture*

Food access is a multi-faceted issue. Because food has not been treated as a public good, **over 1.1 billion people globally, including ~10% of the U.S., are food insecure;** meaning they have limited access to stores that offer a variety of healthy and affordable food. This creates severe challenges:
### Public Health
- **Stunted Childhoods and Learning Disorders**: "Longitudinal studies in Canada indicate that hunger is related to poor health outcomes, including a higher risk of depression and suicidal ideation in adolescents, and chronic conditions, particularly asthma. In addition, nutrient deficiencies, such as iron deficiency, are known to impair learning and cause decreased productivity in school-age children, and maternal depressive disorders." - [Food insecurity and hunger: A review of the effects on children’s health and behaviour](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4373582/)
- **Cardiovascular Disease**: A study published in [the Journal of the American Heart Association](https://www.ahajournals.org/doi/full/10.1161/JAHA.119.014629) included more than 27,000 adults surveyed from 1999 to 2014. Researchers found more cardiovascular disease and higher overall death rates among those reporting food insecurity.
- **Obesity**: "Highly energy-dense processed foods that are high in saturated fats, sugars, and sodium are consumed more often than micronutrient-dense quality foods. Energy-dense foods may help meet daily caloric requirements, but essential nutrients are missing. Therefore, in many countries, undernutrition and obesity coexist and both can be consequences of food insecurity." - [Food insecurity as a risk factor for obesity: A review](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9549066/)
### Economic Opportunity
- Individuals who live in low-income, low-access neighborhoods tend to deal with employment challenges. This is often due to a lack of economic opportunity in their neigborhood, a lack of positive role models, and interactions with the criminal justice system.
### Global Supply Chains
- In the United States, processed foods travel an average of 1,300 miles (~2,100 KM), and fresh produce travels an average of 1,500  miles (~2,400 KM) to get to your local grocery store. - [Food Miles: Background and Marketing](https://attra.ncat.org/publication/food-miles-background-and-marketing/#:~:text=The%20Leopold%20Center%20found%20that,traveled%20amounted%20to%201%2C518%20miles.)

- The United Nation's [2021 State of Food and Agriculture report](https://www.fao.org/3/cb4476en/online/cb4476en.html) states that in over 45 nations, the closure of a single route could increase food travel times by 20%+

---

## 💡 **Proposed Solution**
🌐 [*https://thecityfarmers.org/*](https://thecityfarmers.org/)

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Skh4ws0x6.png)


📝 *This is what we're building towards, the 10-year vision.
Vertical farming in solar glass greenhouses.* 

**** is the premier program of the Kenwood Training Center, a 501c3 non-profit headquartered in Chicago.

We are dedicated to empowering individuals, particularly those with criminal records and veterans, through comprehensive training in sustainable urban agriculture.  Our goal is to promote self-sufficiency and personal growth by equipping them with the skills to operate and own their own greenhouses.

Parallel to this, we champion vibrant neighborhoods. By transforming vacant city lots into commercial agricultural greenhouses, we contribute to the vitality and sustainability of urban communities.

Our finances are managed by the Public Health Institute of Metropolitan Chicago, another 501c3 non-profit, in return for 10% of all donations received.

---

## 🌟 **Opportunity**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rk9EuERea.jpg)

📝 *We have the opportunity today to get ahead of an exponential global trend.*
*Source: [Data Bridge Market Research](https://www.databridgemarketresearch.com/reports/global-urban-farming-market)*

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkDeetCe6.png)

📝 *"In 2022, food spending by U.S. consumers, businesses, and government entities totaled $2.39 trillion" - [Economic Research Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture](https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/ag-and-food-statistics-charting-the-essentials/food-prices-and-spending/#:~:text=U.S.%20food%20spending%20in%202020%20totaled%20%241.81%20trillion.,trillion%20in%202021%20to%20%241.34%20trillion%20in%202022.)*

### **Research & Develop Urban Agriculture** 
- Kobe University's Graduate School of Agricultural Science in Japan has researched dry-fog aeroponics since 2011. When growing lettuce, this method uses 90-95% less water and 98% less land than traditional agriculture. We can build upon this research to include new crops and refine the method, in partnership with the [Illinois Institute of Technology's Institute of Food Safety & Health](https://www.ifsh.iit.edu/) and the United States Department of Agriculture, who are opening their first ever Urban Ag office in Chicago towards the end of this year and have $9 million of grants we qualify for.
### **Bring Ag Carbon Onchain** 
- We're in conversation with developers focused on omnichain & web2 interopability to bring [agricultrual carbon data](https://cid-inc.com/plant-science-tools/leaf-area-measurement/ci-340-handheld-photosynthesis-system/) onchain. There are millions of dollars of government and private grants available for this R&D work.
### **Food as Medicine**
- Public health agencies and providers are increasingly recognizing the role of food and nutrition in health outcomes. The Public Health Institute of Metropolitan Chicago has partnered with us and manages our finances. Their deep connections in the pubic health field place us in a strong position to secure grants for this work. 
### **Workforce Development** 
- PHIMC also has deep connections with the Illinois Department of Justice and a commitment to restorative justice programs. It is our goal to leverage this to create a workorce development program for individuals with criminal records. We have a pilot location in mind next door to a Juvenile Detention Facility in Chicago.
### **Grassroots Community Empowerment**
- By refining the methods and educating the people, Nouns stands to empower low-income, low-access neighborhoods to develop into thriving, sustainable communities by directly addressing their core issues: *health, local nutritious food, and equitable employment.*
### **Ultimate Proliferation**
- Bringing Nouns into the grocery store, refigerator, and people's stomachs makes it a household brand, while living true to the founding principles of positive impact through public goods.

### **Nouns is an engine for the development of public goods.**
Access to fresh, nutritionally rich foods is a key determinent of long term mental health and physical wellness. *By reframing food as a public good, we have the potential to uplift the whole of society and proliferate the meme through the direct route to people's hearts: their stomachs.*

Our mission to make nutrious food a public good may be ambitious, however the impact that success would have across society makes it an obvious bet.

# **Wet Butt, So What? Noun's Bidet Revolution!** 
# TLDR
MakeWater is seeking $34,000 USDC to provide low-income families with Nouns-branded bidets, educate the community on their benefits, and produce high-quality video content showcasing the initiative.

# Summary 

With a $34,000 proposal, MakeWater aims to shift U.S. bathroom culture by promoting bidets, a net positive for the environment and households. Bidets can slash toilet paper costs, boost hygiene, and ease water infrastructure stress. Our pilot will provide Nouns-branded bidets to low-to-middle-income families, complete with DIY installation videos. 
The initiative involves an educational drive where students, acting as citizen scientists, gather and share data on bidet usage and delve into water issues in their region. This hands-on approach also includes field trips to local water facilities, providing them with a comprehensive understanding of bidet advantages. By partnering with water utilities and local governments, we envision a self-sustaining model, continually championing bidet use. 
As this initiative grabs headlines, Nouns will stand out as the pioneering force behind it. Your support will be the kickstart we need!

**Update** We’ve updated the proposal after listening to feedback and reduced the initial ask, explained our goal for a self-sustained program (no future nouns funding required), and highlighted how Nouns will be seen as the hero catalyzing this revolutionary change in bathroom culture.







# How will it work?
[![Screen Shot 2023-09-20 at 10.20.35 AM|690x388](https://global.discourse-cdn.com/standard17/uploads/lilnouns/original/1X/64fdc44ca71b4895023689cf724500b0b393e1b8.jpeg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zr56zofQX2o)

Our  journey will start with our pilot program in South Texas which will be a pivotal step for data collection, refining strategies, and pinpointing best practices. We are delighted to have already gained the enthusiastic support and active engagement of local utilities and educators,  who will propel the growth of our community and our vision.
Through our ongoing community-building efforts, we will strive to gather a strong initial group of participants in South Texas, our pilot region. Far from being just beneficiaries, these participants will become pioneers, actively contributing to data collection and shaping a communal narrative through social media engagement. These authentic stories, personal experiences and testimonials,  will initiate a cultural shift towards bidet use and create a united front against water wastage.
The Nouns DAO can kickstart this effort, providing the initial push needed to get the ball rolling. But this isn't just a one-time splash; it's a tide of transformation! The real heart of this initiative is its ability to keep going on its own. Our goal is more than just handing out affordable bidets; it's about making a lasting change in how people use bathrooms in America.
This initiative will be a wave of change that keeps building and reaching farther. Our pilot program marks the first splash, but together, we have the power to reshape perspectives, enhance water sustainability, and fundamentally revolutionize water habits across the United States.

**Want a Limited Edition Golden Nouns Bidet ⌐◨-◨?** 
Donate 0.05 ETH or more at  [https://app.endaoment.org/orgs/81-1369592](https://app.endaoment.org/orgs/81-1369592).
All contributions further our mission, and as a token of our appreciation, you'll receive the exclusive bidet.


# Why Bidets?
Enter the humble toilet-mounted bidet — a nifty contraption that adds a touch of luxury to your bathroom routine. It replaces or fits beneath the toilet seat and uses a a nozzle to spray water for cleansing. Its installation is easy and doesn't demand a plumbing professional. Many models even showcase features like adjustable pressure, temperature control, and self-cleaning. Beyond all that, however, lies an ecological marvel— a cost-effective solution that promotes better hygiene while reducing toilet paper waste.

Bidets have garnered worldwide recognition for their remarkable water-saving abilities and paper-reducing magic. Embracing bidets translates to preserving trees, conserving water, and reducing the energy dedicated to manufacturing and transporting toilet paper.

Their appeal isn't just environmental; it's also rooted in hygiene. Bidets offer hands-free, pristine cleanliness, an invaluable health advantage, especially in a time when global health awareness is at its peak.

Our aging water infrastructure poses yet another challenge. Sewage systems of many cities groan under the weight of non-degradable items. These infrastructures were designed for a different era, and non-degradable products like wet wipes weren't part of the plan. Despite their convenience, wipes don't break down in water like toilet paper does. This leads to stubborn blockages, damages to equipment, and ultimately, significant repair costs that households and communities have to bear.

Bidets, however, offer a sustainable lifeboat. By adopting bidets, we curtail clogs and damages, sparing households and cities from hefty repair costs. It's not just a bathroom upgrade; it's a blueprint for economic resilience, environmental harmony, and public health.

The Nouns DAO can kickstart this effort, providing the initial push needed to get the ball rolling. But this isn't just a one-time splash; it's a tide of transformation! The real heart of this initiative is its ability to keep going on its own. Our goal is more than just handing out affordable bidets; it's about making a lasting change in how people use bathrooms in America.
This initiative will be a wave of change that keeps building and reaching farther. Our pilot program marks the first splash, but together, we have the power to reshape perspectives, enhance water sustainability, and fundamentally revolutionize water habits across the United States.

**Want a Limited Edition Golden Nouns Bidet ⌐◨-◨?** 
Donate 0.05 ETH or more at  [https://app.endaoment.org/orgs/81-1369592](https://app.endaoment.org/orgs/81-1369592).
All contributions further our mission, and as a token of our appreciation, you'll receive the exclusive bidet.


# Why Bidets?
Enter the humble toilet-mounted bidet — a nifty contraption that adds a touch of luxury to your bathroom routine. It replaces or fits beneath the toilet seat and uses a a nozzle to spray water for cleansing. Its installation is easy and doesn't demand a plumbing professional. Many models even showcase features like adjustable pressure, temperature control, and self-cleaning. Beyond all that, however, lies an ecological marvel— a cost-effective solution that promotes better hygiene while reducing toilet paper waste.

Bidets have garnered worldwide recognition for their remarkable water-saving abilities and paper-reducing magic. Embracing bidets translates to preserving trees, conserving water, and reducing the energy dedicated to manufacturing and transporting toilet paper.

Their appeal isn't just environmental; it's also rooted in hygiene. Bidets offer hands-free, pristine cleanliness, an invaluable health advantage, especially in a time when global health awareness is at its peak.

Our aging water infrastructure poses yet another challenge. Sewage systems of many cities groan under the weight of non-degradable items. These infrastructures were designed for a different era, and non-degradable products like wet wipes weren't part of the plan. Despite their convenience, wipes don't break down in water like toilet paper does. This leads to stubborn blockages, damages to equipment, and ultimately, significant repair costs that households and communities have to bear.

Bidets, however, offer a sustainable lifeboat. By adopting bidets, we curtail clogs and damages, sparing households and cities from hefty repair costs. It's not just a bathroom upgrade; it's a blueprint for economic resilience, environmental harmony, and public health.

# The City Farmers

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/SylB1lAep.png)

## Developing the workforce by decentralizing agriculture in blighted food deserts.

[https://thecityfarmers.org/](https://thecityfarmers.org/)

---
## 📌 **TLDR**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1zlywmW6.png)


### **Requesting 300,000 USDC**

- Rent a warehouse.
- Purchase growing equipment and materials.
- Hire a grantwriter and a videographer/editor.
- Become self-sustaining without requiring further funding.

*Funding the research & development of urban agriculture as a public good, while proliferating Nouns ⌐◨-◨*

---

## 🧑‍🌾 **Background & Problem Statement**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1o4vxAla.jpg)
*📝 Map of low-income and low-access areas in the U.S. 
Source: Economic Research Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture*

Food access is a multi-faceted issue. Because food has not been treated as a public good, **over 1.1 billion people globally, including ~10% of the U.S., are food insecure;** meaning they have limited access to stores that offer a variety of healthy and affordable food. This creates severe challenges:
### Public Health
- **Stunted Childhoods and Learning Disorders**: "Longitudinal studies in Canada indicate that hunger is related to poor health outcomes, including a higher risk of depression and suicidal ideation in adolescents, and chronic conditions, particularly asthma. In addition, nutrient deficiencies, such as iron deficiency, are known to impair learning and cause decreased productivity in school-age children, and maternal depressive disorders." - [Food insecurity and hunger: A review of the effects on children’s health and behaviour](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4373582/)
- **Cardiovascular Disease**: A study published in [the Journal of the American Heart Association](https://www.ahajournals.org/doi/full/10.1161/JAHA.119.014629) included more than 27,000 adults surveyed from 1999 to 2014. Researchers found more cardiovascular disease and higher overall death rates among those reporting food insecurity.
- **Obesity**: "Highly energy-dense processed foods that are high in saturated fats, sugars, and sodium are consumed more often than micronutrient-dense quality foods. Energy-dense foods may help meet daily caloric requirements, but essential nutrients are missing. Therefore, in many countries, undernutrition and obesity coexist and both can be consequences of food insecurity." - [Food insecurity as a risk factor for obesity: A review](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9549066/)
### Economic Opportunity
- Individuals who live in low-income, low-access neighborhoods tend to deal with employment challenges. This is often due to a lack of economic opportunity in their neigborhood, a lack of positive role models, and interactions with the criminal justice system.
### Global Supply Chains
- In the United States, processed foods travel an average of 1,300 miles (~2,100 KM), and fresh produce travels an average of 1,500  miles (~2,400 KM) to get to your local grocery store. - [Food Miles: Background and Marketing](https://attra.ncat.org/publication/food-miles-background-and-marketing/#:~:text=The%20Leopold%20Center%20found%20that,traveled%20amounted%20to%201%2C518%20miles.)

- The United Nation's [2021 State of Food and Agriculture report](https://www.fao.org/3/cb4476en/online/cb4476en.html) states that in over 45 nations, the closure of a single route could increase food travel times by 20%+

---

## 💡 **Proposed Solution**
🌐 [*https://thecityfarmers.org/*](https://thecityfarmers.org/)

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Skh4ws0x6.png)


📝 *This is what we're building towards, the 10-year vision.
Vertical farming in solar glass greenhouses.* 

**** is the premier program of the Kenwood Training Center, a 501c3 non-profit headquartered in Chicago.

We are dedicated to empowering individuals, particularly those with criminal records and veterans, through comprehensive training in sustainable urban agriculture.  Our goal is to promote self-sufficiency and personal growth by equipping them with the skills to operate and own their own greenhouses.

Parallel to this, we champion vibrant neighborhoods. By transforming vacant city lots into commercial agricultural greenhouses, we contribute to the vitality and sustainability of urban communities.

Our finances are managed by the Public Health Institute of Metropolitan Chicago, another 501c3 non-profit, in return for 10% of all donations received.

---

## 🌟 **Opportunity**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rk9EuERea.jpg)

📝 *We have the opportunity today to get ahead of an exponential global trend.*
*Source: [Data Bridge Market Research](https://www.databridgemarketresearch.com/reports/global-urban-farming-market)*

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkDeetCe6.png)

📝 *"In 2022, food spending by U.S. consumers, businesses, and government entities totaled $2.39 trillion" - [Economic Research Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture](https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/ag-and-food-statistics-charting-the-essentials/food-prices-and-spending/#:~:text=U.S.%20food%20spending%20in%202020%20totaled%20%241.81%20trillion.,trillion%20in%202021%20to%20%241.34%20trillion%20in%202022.)*

### **Research & Develop Urban Agriculture** 
- Kobe University's Graduate School of Agricultural Science in Japan has researched dry-fog aeroponics since 2011. When growing lettuce, this method uses 90-95% less water and 98% less land than traditional agriculture. We can build upon this research to include new crops and refine the method, in partnership with the [Illinois Institute of Technology's Institute of Food Safety & Health](https://www.ifsh.iit.edu/) and the United States Department of Agriculture, who are opening their first ever Urban Ag office in Chicago towards the end of this year and have $9 million of grants we qualify for.
### **Bring Ag Carbon Onchain** 
- We're in conversation with developers focused on omnichain & web2 interopability to bring [agricultrual carbon data](https://cid-inc.com/plant-science-tools/leaf-area-measurement/ci-340-handheld-photosynthesis-system/) onchain. There are millions of dollars of government and private grants available for this R&D work.
### **Food as Medicine**
- Public health agencies and providers are increasingly recognizing the role of food and nutrition in health outcomes. The Public Health Institute of Metropolitan Chicago has partnered with us and manages our finances. Their deep connections in the pubic health field place us in a strong position to secure grants for this work. 
### **Workforce Development** 
- PHIMC also has deep connections with the Illinois Department of Justice and a commitment to restorative justice programs. It is our goal to leverage this to create a workorce development program for individuals with criminal records. We have a pilot location in mind next door to a Juvenile Detention Facility in Chicago.
### **Grassroots Community Empowerment**
- By refining the methods and educating the people, Nouns stands to empower low-income, low-access neighborhoods to develop into thriving, sustainable communities by directly addressing their core issues: *health, local nutritious food, and equitable employment.*
### **Ultimate Proliferation**
- Bringing Nouns into the grocery store, refigerator, and people's stomachs makes it a household brand, while living true to the founding principles of positive impact through public goods.

### **Nouns is an engine for the development of public goods.**
Access to fresh, nutritionally rich foods is a key determinent of long term mental health and physical wellness. *By reframing food as a public good, we have the potential to uplift the whole of society and proliferate the meme through the direct route to people's hearts: their stomachs.*

Our mission to make nutrious food a public good may be ambitious, however the impact that success would have across society makes it an obvious bet.

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BkM-plV-T.png)

As a 29 year old non-profit that was incubated in the City of Chicago's Department of Health, they play a crucial role in monitoring our financial performance and provide an extra layer of accountability, governance, and legal compliance to our finances. # 100 GIFS in 100  DAYS - NOUNS GIF COLLECTION

# Feedback

I have received New feedback from the nouns. Therefore, I reconsidered two aspects:

The amount of ETH will decrease from 10 ETH to 6.5 ETH for the same quantity of GIFs.

The other point revolved around the other "nounish" GIFs. Further down in this proposal, I will detail why GIFs featuring nouns as protagonists are very important and complement those.

**Also onizuka.eth asked About Distribution:**

All the GIFs will be part of a Giphy collection in an account called 'Nouns GIFs.' Each GIF will include the 'What is Nouns DAO' video as the source. This way, every person who receives the GIF will be able to learn more about that character.

Of course, every piece of creation, including my 3D models, will be  CC0 and shared with the community. This means that in the future, if we want to turn the GIFs into collectible NFTs, we will be able to do so.

Every GIF will be shared with the Nouns Twitter account manager for distribution to the community.

All 100 GIFs and files will be stored in a folder accessible to the community at any time.

------------

# Description

I would like to share the proposal I have been working on, as I believe it could greatly benefit the proliferation of our beloved **Nouns**, something we all cherish in this community.

The proposal I have in mind is **simple** yet **powerful**: I want to create a large number of **2D** and **3D** gifs and stickers featuring Nouns characters. These gifs and stickers will be communicative, humorous and **relatable** with the aim of reaching a wider audience with Nouns characters and encouraging their recurring use.

## Goal

The goal is to make GIFs that people both inside and outside the world of nouns can use. This way, they'll start incorporating nouns into their **daily lives**. Plus, GIFs are currently one of the most viral forms of content because their primary purpose is to be shared to convey an idea, emotion, or joke.

![alt text](https://media.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExd2kycWx5YWR1MTRyeXdhcmRlMzI0ZGI5Z3k2cG1yZGZiNzY5cjBkYSZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/MKr18qpDptEKhk6yWp/giphy.gif)

## Pudgy Penguins

A successful case we can take as a reference is  "Pudgy Penguins" Gif collection. With just a few months of gif publications, the Pudgies reached many new people and quickly became popular.

![alt text](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FYhMxqhWQAMKjfm.jpg)

![alt text](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fit:1244/1*_-RtCt584lViXV8EureZ_A.png)

![alt text](https://media.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExcHI2Y2liODd3a3cwbjlvcjRxbzZtZzMxem5yOXIzN2d1ZTljOWc5byZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/7Z6pYYjzYNPyPkS6yb/giphy.gif)

Another important aspect is that producing gifs is more cost-effective than producing videos, and unlike videos, the gifs we create today can be used indefinitely.

## Nounish Gifs

Currently, the Nounish team is crafting some  cool GIFs for nouns. It's a clever strategy to enhance familiar images by adding the noggles on top of them. However, most regular folks probably don't know what these "noggles" are. That's why these GIFs introduce the characters behind the "noggles" brand. These will complement the current ones beautifully!

Character GIFs are very useful for a brand because users become more attached to the characters and what they represent with each passing day. Currently, neither the community nor individuals outside it have the opportunity to use small nouns to communicate, as the Pudgy Penguins community does. This proposal aims to address that need.

![alt text](https://media.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExNm8wZHk1OHBpYzIxaWJvOWd6ZW53MWd4ZnNiMDBhM2t3Z3ZxbGVkcyZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/5DKoUvpIwMLPCMpr1v/giphy.gif)

To carry out this proposal, I'll be teaming up with my friend and colleague Santiago Pereyra. He will handle the 2D animations while I will take care of the 3D animations. Below, I've included some samples of our work:

## 🧑‍🌾 **Background & Problem Statement**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1o4vxAla.jpg)
*📝 Map of low-income and low-access areas in the U.S. 
Source: Economic Research Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture*

Food access is a multi-faceted issue. Because food has not been treated as a public good, **over 1.1 billion people globally, including ~10% of the U.S., are food insecure;** meaning they have limited access to stores that offer a variety of healthy and affordable food. This creates severe challenges:
### Public Health
- **Stunted Childhoods and Learning Disorders**: "Longitudinal studies in Canada indicate that hunger is related to poor health outcomes, including a higher risk of depression and suicidal ideation in adolescents, and chronic conditions, particularly asthma. In addition, nutrient deficiencies, such as iron deficiency, are known to impair learning and cause decreased productivity in school-age children, and maternal depressive disorders." - [Food insecurity and hunger: A review of the effects on children’s health and behaviour](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4373582/)
- **Cardiovascular Disease**: A study published in [the Journal of the American Heart Association](https://www.ahajournals.org/doi/full/10.1161/JAHA.119.014629) included more than 27,000 adults surveyed from 1999 to 2014. Researchers found more cardiovascular disease and higher overall death rates among those reporting food insecurity.
- **Obesity**: "Highly energy-dense processed foods that are high in saturated fats, sugars, and sodium are consumed more often than micronutrient-dense quality foods. Energy-dense foods may help meet daily caloric requirements, but essential nutrients are missing. Therefore, in many countries, undernutrition and obesity coexist and both can be consequences of food insecurity." - [Food insecurity as a risk factor for obesity: A review](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9549066/)
### Economic Opportunity
- Individuals who live in low-income, low-access neighborhoods tend to deal with employment challenges. This is often due to a lack of economic opportunity in their neigborhood, a lack of positive role models, and interactions with the criminal justice system.
### Global Supply Chains
- In the United States, processed foods travel an average of 1,300 miles (~2,100 KM), and fresh produce travels an average of 1,500  miles (~2,400 KM) to get to your local grocery store. - [Food Miles: Background and Marketing](https://attra.ncat.org/publication/food-miles-background-and-marketing/#:~:text=The%20Leopold%20Center%20found%20that,traveled%20amounted%20to%201%2C518%20miles.)

- The United Nation's [2021 State of Food and Agriculture report](https://www.fao.org/3/cb4476en/online/cb4476en.html) states that in over 45 nations, the closure of a single route could increase food travel times by 20%+

### **Research & Develop Urban Agriculture** 
- Kobe University's Graduate School of Agricultural Science in Japan has researched dry-fog aeroponics since 2011. When growing lettuce, this method uses 90-95% less water and 98% less land than traditional agriculture. We can build upon this research to include new crops and refine the method, in partnership with the [Illinois Institute of Technology's Institute of Food Safety & Health](https://www.ifsh.iit.edu/) and the United States Department of Agriculture, who are opening their first ever Urban Ag office in Chicago towards the end of this year and have $9 million of grants we qualify for.
### **Bring Ag Carbon Onchain** 
- We're in conversation with developers focused on omnichain & web2 interopability to bring [agricultrual carbon data](https://cid-inc.com/plant-science-tools/leaf-area-measurement/ci-340-handheld-photosynthesis-system/) onchain. - PHIMC also has deep connections with the Illinois Department of Justice and a commitment to restorative justice programs. It is our goal to leverage this to create a workorce development program for individuals with criminal records.

## 🧑‍🌾 **Background & Problem Statement**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1o4vxAla.jpg)
*📝 Map of low-income and low-access areas in the U.S. 
Source: Economic Research Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture*

Food access is a multi-faceted issue. Because food has not been treated as a public good, **over 1.1 billion people globally, including ~10% of the U.S., are food insecure;** meaning they have limited access to stores that offer a variety of healthy and affordable food. This creates severe challenges:
### Public Health
- **Stunted Childhoods and Learning Disorders**: "Longitudinal studies in Canada indicate that hunger is related to poor health outcomes, including a higher risk of depression and suicidal ideation in adolescents, and chronic conditions, particularly asthma. In addition, nutrient deficiencies, such as iron deficiency, are known to impair learning and cause decreased productivity in school-age children, and maternal depressive disorders." - [Food insecurity and hunger: A review of the effects on children’s health and behaviour](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4373582/)
- **Cardiovascular Disease**: A study published in [the Journal of the American Heart Association](https://www.ahajournals.org/doi/full/10.1161/JAHA.119.014629) included more than 27,000 adults surveyed from 1999 to 2014. Researchers found more cardiovascular disease and higher overall death rates among those reporting food insecurity.
- **Obesity**: "Highly energy-dense processed foods that are high in saturated fats, sugars, and sodium are consumed more often than micronutrient-dense quality foods. Energy-dense foods may help meet daily caloric requirements, but essential nutrients are missing. Therefore, in many countries, undernutrition and obesity coexist and both can be consequences of food insecurity." - [Food insecurity as a risk factor for obesity: A review](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9549066/)
### Economic Opportunity
- Individuals who live in low-income, low-access neighborhoods tend to deal with employment challenges. This is often due to a lack of economic opportunity in their neigborhood, a lack of positive role models, and interactions with the criminal justice system.
### Global Supply Chains
- In the United States, processed foods travel an average of 1,300 miles (~2,100 KM), and fresh produce travels an average of 1,500  miles (~2,400 KM) to get to your local grocery store. - [Food Miles: Background and Marketing](https://attra.ncat.org/publication/food-miles-background-and-marketing/#:~:text=The%20Leopold%20Center%20found%20that,traveled%20amounted%20to%201%2C518%20miles.)

- The United Nation's [2021 State of Food and Agriculture report](https://www.fao.org/3/cb4476en/online/cb4476en.html) states that in over 45 nations, the closure of a single route could increase food travel times by 20%+

### **Research & Develop Urban Agriculture** 
- Kobe University's Graduate School of Agricultural Science in Japan has researched dry-fog aeroponics since 2011. When growing lettuce, this method uses 90-95% less water and 98% less land than traditional agriculture. We can build upon this research to include new crops and refine the method, in partnership with the [Illinois Institute of Technology's Institute of Food Safety & Health](https://www.ifsh.iit.edu/) and the United States Department of Agriculture, who are opening their first ever Urban Ag office in Chicago towards the end of this year and have $9 million of grants we qualify for.
### **Bring Ag Carbon Onchain** 
- We're in conversation with developers focused on omnichain & web2 interopability to bring [agricultrual carbon data](https://cid-inc.com/plant-science-tools/leaf-area-measurement/ci-340-handheld-photosynthesis-system/) onchain. There are millions of dollars of government and private grants available for this R&D work.
### **Food as Medicine**
- Public health agencies and providers are increasingly recognizing the role of food and nutrition in health outcomes. The Public Health Institute of Metropolitan Chicago has partnered with us and manages our finances. Their deep connections in the pubic health field place us in a strong position to secure grants for this work. 
### **Workforce Development** 
- PHIMC also has deep connections with the Illinois Department of Justice and a commitment to restorative justice programs. It is our goal to leverage this to create a workorce development program for individuals with criminal records.
### **Grassroots Community Empowerment**
- By refining the methods and educating the people, Nouns stands to empower low-income, low-access neighborhoods to develop into thriving, sustainable communities by directly addressing their core issues: *health, local nutritious food, and equitable employment.*
### **Ultimate Proliferation**
- Bringing Nouns into the grocery store, refigerator, and people's stomachs makes it a household brand, while living true to the founding principles of positive impact through public goods.

# Food should be a public good;
# Nouns is an engine for the development of public goods.
Access to fresh, nutritionally rich foods is a key determinent of long term mental health and physical wellness. *By reframing food as a public good, we have the potential to uplift the whole of society and proliferate the meme through the direct route to people's hearts: their stomachs.*

## Our mission to make nutrious food a public good may be ambitious, however the impact that success would have across society makes it an obvious bet.

# Spec The 🔥 To Eliminate The Put (Requesting Feedback) 

# 

I am proposing parameters to the current proposed implementation of [The Burn](https://w.mirror.xyz/AmHOzH-FQZVO3IhGXHSvCRxRSf2MO6VCZdmMwNEIyKE). I am putting this up to raise awareness among voters, stimulate the conversation, and listen to feedback. 

I will break this down into two sections: a TL;DR for people with a technical background, and a further breakdown to help the general community understand the issue at hand - why I believe the current proposed burn mechanism specs do not eliminate the intrinsic value arbitrage opportunity, and most importantly what can be done to resolve this! 

**TL;DR: I am proposing to change the timeframe that ‘burns’ could potentially occur from 90 days to a fork threshold period of N days.** There are 69 Nouns in Fork 1 - this would bring new circulating supply down to 332 - meaning if all new auction bids are from RFV traders it would take 33 days to trigger a new fork (assuming zero are sold on secondary market below BV). If we keep the proposed 90 days there could be potentially 3+ more rounds of forks before a burn is executed. 

**I am proposing that we change from auction average value to the lowest settlement price within the previous N days (which I am calling fork threshold period).** In order to completely remove the intrinsic value arbitrage opportunity we have to set it to zero. This is done by having the lowest auction price within the previous N days set as the new strike price. If the lowest auction price is above book value then default to book value (as BV would be the redemption value if forked & RQ). These parameters would ensure protection for the DAO when auction prices trend below BV. 

**I am proposing that we do not build this design into the protocol and first test with a manual solution I have described below.** I believe that once we eliminate the intrinsic value arbitrage opportunity completely, this will no longer be an issue to plague the DAO, therefore there is no need to make protocol changes which are time and cost intensive. 

—-----------------------------

**Issue At Hand:** Currently we are faced with an issue that Nouns BV (book value) is higher than the current market demand, therefore creating an intrinsic value arbitrage opportunity to bid in the auction below BV, then Fork & RQ (Rage Quit) a pro rata share of the treasury and capturing a RFV (risk free value) trade. There have been numerous solutions proposed on how to resolve this issue such as burning excess eth, ‘forced spending’, vesting newly minted nouns etc. The issue is, the current proposed solutions do not eliminate the intrinsic value arbitrage opportunity or generate organic market demand for auctions to trade above book value. 

Below I have created a simulation of a Fork Threshold Period that I have set to 40 days, this means it would take 40 days of auctions to mint enough new Nouns to trigger a fork. This includes mock data of potential auction prices and prop spending following current trends of auction prices below book value. 

![Simulation 1](https://imageupload.io/ib/XiXuv0duNPiofdo_1697349635.png)


First we will review this simulation with the current proposed burn structure:

![Current Burn Specs](https://imageupload.io/ib/DvM0rTXmI9JzdIt_1697265039.png)

With this current proposed burn structure we would have to quickly spend or burn 500.58 eth.

**Why This Solution Does Not Eliminate The Arb Opportunity:** We are using an average vs the lowest auction price, therefore there is incentive for the RFV traders to keep the auction average below BV with a large spread. After fork 0 we saw auction prices range from 16-33. Therefore if we assume in the above simulation that the people who bought below are RFV traders, there would be an additional 720.36eth leaving the treasury in the next fork - of which 51.18eth is RFV (Risk Free Value). At this rate we would still be losing eth to arbitrage trades, and between the ‘burn’ & fork we would see 1220.94 eth leaving the treasury. Rinse and repeat every fork threshold until we have organic market demand where all auction prices are consistently above BV. 

—-----------------------------

Next we will review a simulation of my proposed parameters which involves taking the lowest auction price within the last N days (fork threshold). Please note, the first simulation is going to be the most extreme, after this though the arb opportunity is completely closed. This means the actions moving forward of burn, spend or dilute would be much less volatile. 
 
![Proposed Burn Specs](https://imageupload.io/ib/vjRAATPpIQ7smrh_1697265038.png)

From this data you can see that we would be taking the lowest auction price of the last N days (fork threshold period) which becomes the new book value price. Ending BV is 32.47 and we would need to reduce this to match the lowest auction price of 25.7…. There are three options on how we can do this: Burn. Spend. Dilute. 

Burning will be done via sending eth to: 0x000000000000000000000000000000000000dEaD spend would send money to Prop House to be used for future funding of props and builders (as an example), dilute would be done by releasing Nouns into a rewards wallet - still controlled by the DAO, but out of the treasury therefore counted towards circulating supply. 

From the example above the options for this simulation would be to Burn 2945.28 eth, Spend 2945.28 eth by sending it to Prop House for future use, or Dilute by releasing 120 Nouns to a rewards wallet for future distribution. 

**What Can Be Done To Resolve This:** I do not believe any of these choices should be made as a default decision built into the protocol. I believe the community should be presented the data from each fork threshold period and be allowed to make an informed decision on which option they would prefer to execute. The eth can be transferred to an escrow contract so it is out of the treasury and not calculated towards BV while the DAO votes to Burn. Spend. Dilute - If dilution is the option voted on by the DAO, the escrowed eth will be returned to the Treasury after Treasury Nouns are transferred to the rewards wallet. This decision should be executed within N days (I propose 7 as that aligns with the current proposal voting period). 

I am proposing to create a dashboard that will display the following stats and will also serve as a sentiment voting platform for Nouns token holders: 

![Voting Dashboard](https://imageupload.io/ib/LHQ2bhseBWmVvpI_1697314351.png)

During the fork threshold period based on the data provided DAO members can come to vote on which option they would like to choose: Burn. Spend. Dilute. This vote will be done via snapshot and at the end of the fork threshold the results will display the vote, and a community member can put an onchain proposal to execute the collective decision. I believe this will increase governance participation - allow community members to feel they have a say in which option is being chosen, and also allow for decision making based on accurate information vs estimations. 

As I mentioned above the first simulation will be the most extreme and volatile. Here is a simulation where auction prices have a tighter window as we trend towards our goal of auction prices = or > BV. 

![Simulation 2](https://imageupload.io/ib/w7TIlHPEA7QWnZO_1697349635.png)

For simulation 2 with my proposed specs we have an ending BV of 15.84 and the lowest auction price of 15.42. This means we would be presented with the options of burning 350.85 eth, spending 350.85 eth or releasing 30 Nouns into the rewards wallet. 

![Proposed Burn Specs](https://imageupload.io/ib/9yylEzvvYRaXKcv_1697314351.png)

As you can see this is less volatile of a situation vs simulation 1. Once the RFV traders know that there is no longer an intrinsic arb opportunity we should see Nouns find its true market value, and only people bidding and buying into the project who have an aligned vision. 

Auction prices are unknown and game-able if the arb opportunity is still open. This means that even if the idea of the DAO was to spend down the treasury quickly, there would not be accurate data available to make decisions quick enough (as the final numbers are not calculated ‘until it's too late’). Meaning we will not know the true number to burn, spend or dilute until the final days of the 90 day period, and we currently have a 7 day voting period for proposals to pass or fail. If the RFV traders see large props in the pipeline they will adjust their auction bids based on that information. This will result in a constant cat and mouse game until we generate organic market demand for the auction above book value. 

**Disadvantages To Closing Arb Opportunity:** While I personally believe this is the most effective solution to resolve our current issue, I do recognize that there are disadvantages to closing the arb opportunity completely which include the following: 
- **Market Discovery of True Book Value** - This means that we would be faced with volatility during the price discovery phase, are we prepared to see a 12-15 eth Noun during these current market conditions?
- **Decreased Auction Participation** - Currently ~85% of auction bids are from RFV traders, if the arb opportunity is closed we may see a decrease in auction activity until we generate more organic market demand
- **Intrinsic vs Extrinsic Arb Opportunity** - The issue we are currently dealing with involves the intrinsic arb opportunity….. If we remove this we will see traders with more advanced financial strategies come into play, which would involve an extrinsic arb opportunity when auction prices = or > BV (there is a resolution to this issue which can be proposed as a phase 2 as the intrinsic arb is taken care of first)

I have ran other simulations with different auction price & prop spending scenarios and can share with anyone interested.

# Bounce Nouns Across the Metaverse

# TL;DR

The Nouns community has created high quality libraries of Nouns artwork and assets that are incredibly all in the public domain. These are fantastic resources for developers and designers, but can be difficult for non-technical audiences to use. We want to bring accessibility and utility of Nouns to **everyone** by providing a simple, seamless way to use Nouns avatars and art across the best digital platforms and spaces. 

![nounsIntegrations](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/pineappleMosaic.gif)

## Proposal brief
With the Bounce platform, we want to bridge the Nouniverse and the open Metaverse:

- make current and future Nouns easily to use, seamlessly, across digital platforms ⇒ **everyone** can experience and enjoy Nouns, forever
- bring exposure in more spaces to new audiences, both web3 and web2 ⇒ **grow** Nouns community
- build and open and extensible system with a Bounce API & SDK ⇒ **empower** community to innovate and build on top of Bounce

## Feedback

**We’re replying to all feedback in a Q&A section at the end of this proposal**

## Budget

We’re asking for 15 ETH to onboard Nouns onto Bounce and enable cross-world experiences.
The budget includes:

- Build a Nouns X Bounce community microsite
- Cost of asset onboarding and processing all existing and future Nouns for the following platforms:
    - VRChat
    - Mona
    - Snap
    - Instagram
- Making Bounce connections free for everyone, across all spaces, forever
- Developing new platform integrations for spaces the Nouns community is excited about

# Proposal

Bounce is a new cross-world digital asset platform that makes it easy for fans and collectors to embody their avatars in immersive web2 and web3 platforms, and connect with their communities. Our goal is to empower avatar communities to embody their avatars, express themselves and come together in more immersive and engaging ways.

This proposal is to onboard Nouns onto Bounce as an early partner, making Nouns enjoyable by the community across a range of digital spaces, including social, gaming and metaverse platforms

## How Bounce benefits the Nouns community

- Easily enjoy Nouns as avatars, sticker packs, face filters and more across social, gaming and metaverse platforms
- Expand the community and reach of the Nouns brand and content across digital spaces
- Access more platforms and experiences as they roll out, new spaces are available to all Nouns, new and existing
- Support other DAO projects with public API and SDK that make “bouncing” a seamless and hassle-free process
- Bounce Tags support phygital projects with easy onboarding and allocated stock
- Nouns on Bounce will be free for everyone, forever

## Deliverables

The project is estimated at 1.5 to 2 months and will include:

- **A unique Bounce X Nouns microsite** where the community can go to bounce across spaces and enjoy exclusive content. This site also acts as a landing page for special Nouns events and activations across spaces. (EXAMPLE MOCKUP BELOW)
    
    ![nounsMicrositeMockup.jpg](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/nounsPage.jpg)
    
- **Cross platform digital avatars** that can be used as in-space characters, face lenses and filters, sticker packs and more across a range of platforms.
    
    Platforms include:
    
  - VR Chat
    
    ![VRChat Nouns](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/vrchatGifNouns.gif)

    
  - Mona
    
    ![Mona Nouns](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/monaGif.gif)
  
    
  - AR Filters: (ROUGH PROTOTYPE BELOW)
    - Snap
    - Instagram
    
    ![AR Filter Nouns](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/social+lenses.gif)

    
- More spaces the community is excited about
- **Public API, SDK and docs** that can be used by other DAO projects to give utility to digital assets and make bouncing a hassle free integration.
- **Free access to everyone, across all spaces, forever**

We also commit to posting frequent updates on https://www.updates.wtf/ to keep the community informed on progress and updates, both as the proposal is developed, and as future platforms and experiences are rolled out and made available.

# Future proposals

## Bounce X Nouniverse events and community activations

We think the best way to experience bounce as a community is through special events, gatherings and activations. Our collab with the Wassies community was made so much more exciting by their VR Chat Among Us and Zombie Survival (https://twitter.com/ByWassiesEvents)

As Nouns is decentralized, we’d like to put forward future proposals to design, plan, coordinate and market events and games across platforms.

## Bounce Tags for DAO and community projects

Bounce Tags, our secure chain-linked NFC tags, are integrated into the Bounce ecosystem and make bouncing from a physical collectible to digital spaces a quick and seamless experience. Many DAO proposals are dedicated to crafting both amazing new Nouns physical products (Noggle Changers, NounsDAO x Pudgy Penguins toys, NOUNISH FRIENDS mini-figures, etc), and these could all be linked using tags (think tapping your Nouns glasses and bouncing to Nouns AR filters and more). We would like to put forward a future proposal to provide tags for community projects (as part of their proposals) that will be custom designed, programmed and integrated with our support. 

# Who we are

## About Bounce

Bounce is a new cross-world avatar platform that makes it easy for fans and collectors to embody their avatars in immersive web2 and web3 platforms, and connect with their communities. We automate all platform-specific integrations, such as coding, rigging, file conversions and API & SDK connections, making it simple to use a unique physical or digital collectible (such as NFTs, sneakers, trading cards and more), generated based on unique traits, as an avatar across platforms. Our Bounce Tag uses active encryption NFC to ensure a secure and permanent link between authentic physical goods and their digital counterparts.

- Learn more about Bounce - [letsbounce.gg](http://www.letsbounce.gg/)

## Bounce partnerships with avatar communities

A great example of how Bounce can help engage and activate a web3 community is our recent partnership with Wassies. Bounce allows the Wassies community to enjoy their fridge-dwelling creatures in new ways, from face filters on Snap and Instagram, to custom avatars on VR Chat, and create unique HD renders of their Wassie. 

Wassies on Bounce can be viewed by everyone, holders can bounce their held ones, and CC0 Wassies are available for everyone to bounce.

Response from the Wassies community has been great, and the team has created a series of engaging events on Twitter and VR Chat that brought together fans and holders to play games, show off their unique renders and wassify their socials. 

Below is footage from a Wassies concert in VRChat this weekend, powered by the Bounce VRChat integration.  
![Wassie Event](https://baunsu.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/nouns/wassiesEvent.gif)

## Links

- [Microsite for Bounce collab with Wassies](https://beta.letsbounce.gg/wassies)
- [Wassies announcement tweet](https://twitter.com/bywassies/status/1709554217331949818) (41.4k impressions)
- [Wassies VRChat event](https://twitter.com/bywassies/status/1710625261178228794)

## The Team

Bounce is developed by Barak & Jasper, experienced creative technologists and builders in web3. Previously, they worked together at a Japanese art collective, [teamLab](https://www.teamlab.art/), and in 2021 they co-founded [Strata](https://www.strata.gallery/), a digital art incubator.  At Strata, they developed [DenDekaDen](https://www.dendekaden.com/) with Toei Animation (the Japanese animation studio behind One Piece and Dragon Ball Z).

- More on [Barak](https://twitter.com/barakchamo)
- More on [Jasper](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jasper-degens-7269a256/)

## Q&A

**onizuka.eth - Abstained**

**Q**: I think there is a value in proliferating across Snap/Instagram, but I think there has already been progress made on filters there (from CoralOrca?) I'm not sure what exactly the public API would be for? general infrastructure like this can be valuable, but I'm not optimistic about something like the bounce site getting any sort of use from such a decentralized org like Nouns

**A**: Great feedback and thanks for bringing up these points. CoralOrca and 0xFloyd have done fantastic work on [social filters](https://www.snapchat.com/explore/nouns/lenses), as well as [Noun 3D models](https://3dnouns.xyz/). This proposal builds on top of both of these by providing a hub where all experiences are easily accessible, not only social filters but also VR Chat, Mona, and any other platforms that will be integrated into Bounce in the future.

Our goal is to make these cross-platform experiences easily accessible through all DAO projects, both web (with a public API to link directly to Nouns experiences) and physical (Bounce NFC tags, QR codes). The Bounce site will act as a hub for Nouns and other onboarded projects, and will help bring in other users and communities into the Nouniverse.
